intro: Agelanthus entebbensis, commonly known as the Uganda agelanthus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa, particularly Uganda. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other economically important trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, fragrant flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological roles in its native habitat.
